info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 7 at 6:50AM EDT until April 7 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Macon.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen.
Elevated stream levels can be expected on the Nantahala River around Rainbow Springs. Other streams in western Macon County could reach bank full conditions. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nantahala Lake, Rainbow Springs, Wayah Bald, Aquone, Kyle and Otto. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
